terms.definition: A specific section of US federal law that details the exclusive rights granted to copyright owners.
A formal request or order for someone to stop an action and not to start it again.
A legal document sent to demand that someone immediately stop an unlawful activity and not resume it.
A postal service that provides proof that a letter was mailed and delivered, often requiring a signature.
The illegal act of using, reproducing, or distributing a copyrighted work without the owner's permission.
The government agency in the United States responsible for registering copyrights and related documents.
A specific request or requirement that has already been mentioned earlier.
A legal protection that grants the creator of an original work exclusive rights to its use and distribution, usually for a set period.
An original creative work, such as a book, song, or image, that is protected by copyright law.
The act of personally performing one of the actions (like copying) that violates a copyright.
Specific legal rights granted to a copyright owner that allow them to control who can use or reproduce their work.
Any further acts of violating a copyright or other legal right that may occur later.
An action or declaration that is formally or officially performed at this very moment.
Content or work that illegally copies or uses copyrighted material without permission.
A formal agreement that grants someone permission to use copyrighted material under specific conditions.
Official or legal approval to do something.
Making a copyrighted work visible to the general public.
When this letter is received by someone.
A unique identifying number assigned to something when it's officially recorded.
The act of making one or more copies of a copyrighted work.
The only person or entity with complete legal ownership and control over something.
Using or sharing something without the legal right or permission.
A document or message in writing that verifies an agreement, action, or fact.
